commit_message:
Revise End User Guide to make style consistent for procedures

bug: #1214054

Change-Id: I5380b5342fbb82593fc0931d09e66518dcb4e904
author: diane fleming
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/32/42732/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <version>1.9.2</version>
deleted_lines: <version>1.8.0</version>

subject: Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-08 10:25:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/30bf1db09e1453f2f9ee01d93a11c150f23d9133', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

This patch implement creating local volume to Ceph cluster, and create snapshot
with root parition to upload to glance with volume in Ceph cluster.

The path to create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will enter my
hack code and import the image to ceph cluster from _base directory.  Finally,
qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to VM.

The path to create snapshot with root image:
1 If the instance is running and because rbd support parallel access, we can
use qemu-img converting the root image to a raw image in local filesystem as
snapshot directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance
Because the libvirt code implementing creat snapshot is complicated and consider
the other file format without parallel access supporting, there exists two path
to implement it. They are in imagebackend.py and driver.py:_live_snapshot
respectively.

Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-08 10:36:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ff87f8bd21b604c9ea3124efc3f11c04a05913a2', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

This patch implement creating local volume to Ceph cluster, and create snapshot
with root parition to upload to glance with volume in Ceph cluster.

The path to create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will enter my
hack code and import the image to ceph cluster from _base directory.  Finally,
qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to VM.

The path to create snapshot with root image:
1 If the instance is running and because rbd support parallel access, we can
use qemu-img converting the root image to a raw image in local filesystem as
snapshot directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance
Because the libvirt code implementing creat snapshot is complicated and consider
the other file format without parallel access supporting, there exists two path
to implement it. They are in imagebackend.py and driver.py:_live_snapshot
respectively.

bp: Bring RBD support to libvirt_images_type
Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-07-09 05:36:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/06576c1e4a072ef65352a0ed8d5da76c78ce5580', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

This patch implement creating local volume to Ceph cluster, and create snapshot
with root parition to upload to glance with volume in Ceph cluster.

The path to create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will enter my
hack code and import the image to ceph cluster from _base directory.  Finally,
qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to VM.

The path to create snapshot with root image:
1 Because rbd support parallel access, whatever the instance is running or not,
we always use "qemu-img convert" command to convert the root image in ceph
cluster to raw format and store it in local filesystem directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance and delete the local snapshot.

bp: Bring RBD support to libvirt_images_type
Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e

'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2013-07-12 14:35:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bb440211c7f404d46810ef5b8244cb5ac53c2645', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

This patch implements these:
1. Creating local volume from Ceph cluster.
2. Creating the snapshot of root parition and upload it to glance.

To create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will call
`create_image()` that imagebackend implemented and import the image to ceph
cluster from _base directory.  Finally, qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to
VM.

To create snapshot with root image:
1 Because rbd support parallel access, whatever the instance is running or not,
we always use "qemu-img convert" command to convert the root image in ceph
cluster to raw format and store it in local filesystem directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance and delete the local snapshot.

Implement: blueprint bring-rbd-support-libvirt-images-type
Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2013-07-13 04:05:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e0a50003fbf7c0de7a6136a3bb72608ddc6e9528', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

The block storage in OpenStack is divided into Nova and Cinder, Nova is
responsible for local volume such as root, swap and ephemeral partition. Cinder
is responsible for normal volume(global volume?). This mode will make difficult
for planning storage allocation. In order to improve the availability of
storage capacity and reduce the complexity of storage allocation, implementing
the unified storage for local volume in Nova and volumes in Cinder is
necessary.

Now Nova supports lvm backend for creating local volume. Ceph as a Cinder
backend we want to implement it too in Nova.

This patch implements these:
1. Creating local volume from Ceph cluster.
2. Creating the snapshot of root parition and upload it to glance.

To create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will call
`create_image()` that imagebackend implemented and import the image to ceph
cluster from _base directory.  Finally, qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to
VM.

To create snapshot with root image:
1 Because rbd support parallel access, whatever the instance is running or not,
we always use "qemu-img convert" command to convert the root image in ceph
cluster to raw format and store it in local filesystem directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance and delete the local snapshot.

Implement: blueprint bring-rbd-support-libvirt-images-type
Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e
'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2013-07-15 12:03:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f1ae1d8215471cecda5d8d0a99ad700660fdf5c7', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

The block storage in OpenStack is divided into Nova and Cinder, Nova is
responsible for local volume such as root, swap and ephemeral partition. Cinder
is responsible for normal volume(global volume?). This mode will make difficult
for planning storage allocation. In order to improve the availability of
storage capacity and reduce the complexity of storage allocation, implementing
the unified storage for local volume in Nova and volumes in Cinder is
necessary.

Now Nova supports lvm backend for creating local volume. Ceph as a Cinder
backend we want to implement it too in Nova.

This patch implements these:
1. Creating local volume from Ceph cluster.
2. Creating the snapshot of root parition and upload it to glance.

To create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will call
`create_image()` that imagebackend implemented and import the image to ceph
cluster from _base directory.  Finally, qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to
VM.

To create snapshot with root image:
1 Because rbd support parallel access, whatever the instance is running or not,
we always use "qemu-img convert" command to convert the root image in ceph
cluster to raw format and store it in local filesystem directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance and delete the local snapshot.

Implement: blueprint bring-rbd-support-libvirt-images-type
Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e
'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2013-07-15 13:36:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/453d062394ab047c59cbfe50d9b2ab8710b38d9c', 'message': 'Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

The block storage in OpenStack is divided into Nova and Cinder, Nova is
responsible for local volume such as root, swap and ephemeral partition. Cinder
is responsible for normal volume(global volume?). This mode will make difficult
for planning storage allocation. In order to improve the availability of

the unified storage for local volume in Nova and volumes in Cinder is
necessary.

Now Nova supports lvm backend for creating local volume. Ceph as a Cinder
backend we want to implement it too in Nova.

This patch implements these:
1. Creating local volume from Ceph cluster.
2. Creating the snapshot of root parition and upload it to glance.

To create local volume(root, swap or ephemeral):
At first, libvirt will check the image the request specified in _base
directory, fetch the image from glance if not. Then the executer will call
`create_image()` that imagebackend implemented and import the image to ceph
cluster from _base directory.  Finally, qemu-img will attach the rbd://xxxx to
VM.

To create snapshot with root image:
1 Because rbd support parallel access, whatever the instance is running or not,
we always use "qemu-img convert" command to convert the root image in ceph
cluster to raw format and store it in local filesystem directly.
2. Upload the snapshot to Glance and delete the local snapshot.

commit_message:
Add RBD supporting to libvirt for creating local volume

The block storage in OpenStack is divided into Nova and Cinder, Nova is
responsible for local volume such as root, swap and ephemeral partition. Cinder
is responsible for normal volume(global volume?). This mode will make difficult
for planning storage allocation. In order to improve the availability of
storage capacity and reduce the complexity of storage allocation, implementing
the unified storage for local volume in Nova and volumes in Cinder is
necessary.

Now Nova supports lvm backend for creating local volume. Ceph as a Cinder
backend we want to implement it too in Nova.

This patch add RBD backend to libvirt image backend, and users can use specify
rbd as the source of root, ephemeral and swap partition.

Implement: blueprint bring-rbd-support-libvirt-images-type
Change-Id: Id97de5c9af4ddc5c58493a5cef21b52386afac3e

commit_message:
Added time-based score for patches

Based on the number of days since the last patch was posted

Also added a tooltip to explain scores

Change-Id: I1f13a97ddd8714297a331be91146f9742bbb9766
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reviewday refs/changes/36/38836/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import math def _calc_score(self, lp, cur_timestamp): if self.topic.find('bug/') == 0: bug = lp.bug(self.topic[4:]) elif self.topic.find('bp/') == 0: spec = lp.specification(self.project, self.topic[3:]) spec = lp.specification(self.project, self.topic) print 'WARNING: unable to find cause for %s' % self.topic print 'WARNING: unable to find score for (%s, %s)' % (self.topic, cause) return ("No link", "Unknown cause: " + cause, 0) score = cause_score[cause] reason = [cause+" (+%d)"%(score)] # Add a score based on the time the patch has been waiting for approval days_old = int((cur_timestamp - self.revisionCreatedOn) / (60*60*24)) if ((days_old > 0) and (self.lowest_feedback != -2)): # A medium bugfix will have to be around for 10 days before it is # ranked higher than a low feature. days_old_score = 3 * days_old reason.append("%d days old (+%d)"%(days_old, days_old_score)) score = score + days_old_score return (cause, reason, score) def __init__(self, lp, smoker, review, cur_timestamp): self.revisionCreatedOn = review['currentPatchSet']['createdOn'] # Make use of the feedback in calculating the score cause, reason, score = self._calc_score(lp, cur_timestamp) self.score = score self.reason = reason self.cause = cause
deleted_lines: def _calc_score(self, lp, project, topic): if topic.find('bug/') == 0: bug = lp.bug(topic[4:]) elif topic.find('bp/') == 0: spec = lp.specification(project, topic[3:]) spec = lp.specification(project, topic) print 'WARNING: unable to find cause for %s' % topic print 'WARNING: unable to find score for (%s, %s)' % (topic, cause) return ("Unknown cause: " + cause, 0) return (cause, cause_score[cause]) def __init__(self, lp, smoker, review): cause, score = self._calc_score(lp, self.project, self.topic) self.score = score self.cause = cause

subject: Remove broken config_drive image_href support.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-31 23:54:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0b5964edbc593c1f82e9d967c393461ded822350', 'message': "Remove broken config_drive image_href support.

image_href support has not been working since at least shortly before
Folsom release.  This is a good indication that this functionality is not
used.  As far as I can tell, the docs also do not match what was
supported.  An image ID was required, but docs show examples with full
hrefs.

DocImpact

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_ext/ext_config_drive.html

References to supporting image_hrefs should be removed.

Docs also state that 'true' or 'True' (depending on if you use
XML or JSON) or empty strings are returned for detail/show.  The
nova code seems to actually return '1' or an empty string or None.

This has been corrected in this patch to return 'True' (always
capitalized) or '' if it is enabled/disabled respectively.

This patch also removes the hack that passed a config_drive_id via
the Instance dictionary when config_drive_id is not a valid Column for
Instance.

Fixes bug 1186401

Change-Id: Iced7bc8e278cb9f208183f1dbb7a293675a47eae

commit_message:
Remove broken config_drive image_href support.

image_href support has not been working since at least shortly before
Folsom release.  This is a good indication that this functionality is not
used.  As far as I can tell, the docs also do not match what was
supported.  An image ID was required, but docs show examples with full
hrefs.

DocImpact

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_ext/ext_config_drive.html

References to supporting image_hrefs should be removed.

This patch also removes the hack that passed a config_drive_id via
the Instance dictionary when config_drive_id is not a valid Column for
Instance.

Fixes bug 1186401

Change-Id: Iced7bc8e278cb9f208183f1dbb7a293675a47eae

This patch fix a small +# If the patch doesn't apply just do nothing. This patch fixes a small # issue in the script that writes the network configuration files from -# the cmdline to the disk on FC18. -patch /usr/lib/dracut/modules.d/45ifcfg/write-ifcfg.sh < $(dirname $0)/../dracut-write-ifcfg.patch || true +# the cmdline to the disk on FC18/FC19. +# +#for dracut-network 029 we need a different patch: +# http://git.kernel.org/cgit/boot/dracut/dracut.git/commit/?id=613ed5cd764d54cac082a1e7b7e8d1f1fed29d35 +IFCFG_FILE="/usr/lib/dracut/modules.d/45ifcfg/write-ifcfg.sh" +NETGEN_FILE="/usr/lib/dracut/modules.d/40network/net-genrules.sh" + +if patch --dry-run $NETGEN_FILE < $(dirname $0)/../dracut-029-netgen.patch > /dev/null; then + patch $NETGEN_FILE < $(dirname $0)/../dracut-029-netgen.patch || true +else + patch $IFCFG_FILE < $(dirname $0)/../dracut-write-ifcfg.patch || true +fi -- 1.8.1.6

commit_message:
Added 'nova migration-list' command

This command lets Admin's list migrations by applying filters

Implements: blueprint list-resizes-through-admin-api
Change-Id: I587c62dab537186cfc8b387fbc46cdb56fb9976c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/61/37861/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from novaclient.v1_1 import migrations from novaclient.tests import utils from novaclient.tests.v1_1 import fakes cs = fakes.FakeClient() class MigrationsTest(utils.TestCase): def test_list_migrations(self): ml = cs.migrations.list() cs.assert_called('GET', '/os-migrations') [self.assertTrue(isinstance(m, migrations.Migration)) for m in ml] def test_list_migrations_with_filters(self): ml = cs.migrations.list('host1', 'finished', 'child1') cs.assert_called('GET', '/os-migrations?status=finished&host=host1' '&cell_name=child1') [self.assertTrue(isinstance(m, migrations.Migration)) for m in ml]

commit_message:
Update DocBook validating schema to 5.1CR1

Update the RelaxNG schema used by tools/validate.py to 5.1CR1.

This schema is used to validate individual files. The new schema
should allow any entity to be at the root. This should eliminate
false negative xinclude-related validation errors.

Change-Id: I24cfe9bf75fd776eff11fcd1753ded0e7e8a39bd

commit_message:
Add ceilometer api and the tests for it

Adding ceilometer api basic function wrappers.
Adding Class wrapper of each ceilometer object.

Adding ceilometer general usage wrappers for common statistics over
list of Resources and ResourceAggregates.

Adding specific table statistics wrappers.

Adding tests and test data for Ceilometer API.

Best to be tested with commit for resource usage panel at:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35590/ - this commit is for the
test purpose only.

Link to bp: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/ceilometer

Implements bp ceilometer.
Change-Id: I5b3392de8bae2be8cbcba7a580af669676e54052

commit_message:
Change prep_resize paths to use objects

Converts calls to compute's prep_resize to pass a new-world instance
object.

This does not convert the scheduler prep_resize method which is still
called on reschedules.  It will soon be deprecated anyway.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I7a150f119547595aec962d5e5a8d2ab815d0b6c5

commit_message:
Removes fixed ips extension from V3 API

The fixed ip extension was one of the first ported to the V3 API
but a later decision around not supporting nova network in the V3 API
means that this extension is not required for V3. The fixed ip extension
only supports nova network, not neutron and the same functionality
can be accessed directly through neutron.

Also changes some extension tests to use a different extension
for white/black list testing

Partially implements bp nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie589170e863ee489661e789c5134ed8349ced279

subject: Proper usage of _resource property in quotas
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-15 12:56:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/f301b002392c0891b2a2b5823d2e6e0f72160eaf', 'message': "Proper usage of _resource property in quotas

Use resources instead of _resources in several methods.
Use `self.message' attribute in QuotaError constructor.
This errors affect cinder project

Change-Id: Iac85497a956e7c3a8c58bb38337a63d0d5fabc8f
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-16 11:56:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/36ca7fd13c3b6517fe00abd0005d9965aa7064f1', 'message': "Proper usage of _resource property in quotas

Use resources instead of _resources. This is necessary because _resources
actually does not contain all resources in VolumeTypeQuotaEngine, and there
is property-method `resources' was introduced for this.

Use `self.message' attribute in QuotaError constructor. This attribute can
be used for access to exception's message in except block as done in cinder.

Change-Id: Iac85497a956e7c3a8c58bb38337a63d0d5fabc8f
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-08-27 09:40:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/quota.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/9a29d48ef9b000c5b79ba8a12b4332e934c5bce5', 'message': "Proper usage of _resource property in quotas

Use resources instead of _resources. This is necessary because _resources
actually does not contain all resources in VolumeTypeQuotaEngine, and there
is property-method `resources' was introduced for this.

Change-Id: Iac85497a956e7c3a8c58bb38337a63d0d5fabc8f
"}]
commit_message:
Proper usage of _resource property in quotas

Use resources instead of _resources. This is necessary because _resources
actually does not contain all resources in VolumeTypeQuotaEngine, and there
is property-method `resources' was introduced for this.

Change-Id: Iac85497a956e7c3a8c58bb38337a63d0d5fabc8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/18/42118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.message = self.msg_fmt % self.kwargs self.message = self.msg_fmt else: self.message = message return super(QuotaException, self).__init__(self.message) return resource in self.resources return self._driver.get_user_quotas(context, self.resources, return self._driver.get_project_quotas(context, self.resources, return self._driver.get_settable_quotas(context, self.resources, return self._driver.limit_check(context, self.resources, values, reservations = self._driver.reserve(context, self.resources, deltas,
deleted_lines: message = self.msg_fmt % self.kwargs message = self.msg_fmt super(QuotaException, self).__init__(message) return resource in self._resources return self._driver.get_user_quotas(context, self._resources, return self._driver.get_project_quotas(context, self._resources, return self._driver.get_settable_quotas(context, self._resources, return self._driver.limit_check(context, self._resources, values, reservations = self._driver.reserve(context, self._resources, deltas,

subject: parameterize fileutils removal functions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-09 12:02:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/96c07a7a729c6c4445fa0c16647f8d6010803fd1', 'message': "parameterize fileutils removal functions

Currently delete_if_exists() and consequently
remove_path_on_error() only support single files.
So to handle dirs, or trees or higher level operations
it's useful to be able to specify how to remove.

* openstack/common/fileutils.py (delete_if_exists):
Allow passing a removal function.
(remove_path_on_error): Likewise.
* tests/unit/test_fileutils.py (test_dir_present):
Demonstrate/test removal of empty dirs.
(test_remove_dir): Likewise.
(test_remove): Ensure the remove param is honored.

Change-Id: I0ea2498048f09af5f1b9c1bddba677c5813fb2f8

commit_message:
parameterize fileutils removal functions

Currently delete_if_exists() and consequently
remove_path_on_error() only support single files.
So to handle dirs, or trees or higher level operations
it's useful to be able to specify how to remove.

* openstack/common/fileutils.py (delete_if_exists):
Allow passing a removal function.
(remove_path_on_error): Likewise.
* tests/unit/test_fileutils.py (test_dir_present):
Demonstrate/test removal of empty dirs.
(test_remove_dir): Likewise.
(test_remove): Ensure the remove param is honored.

Related:   Idce8d21ae37bfdbb28a2567120a83d1061061904
Change-Id: I0ea2498048f09af5f1b9c1bddba677c5813fb2f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/73/41073/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_dir_present(self): tmpdir = tempfile.mktemp() os.mkdir(tmpfile) fileutils.delete_if_exists(tmpdir, remove=os.rmdir) self.assertFalse(os.path.exists(tmpdir)) def test_remove(self): tmpfile = tempfile.mktemp() open(tmpfile, 'w') try: with fileutils.remove_path_on_error(tmpfile, remove=lambda x: x): raise Exception except Exception: self.assertTrue(os.path.exists(tmpfile)) os.unlink(tmpfile) def test_remove_dir(self): tmpdir = tempfile.mktemp() os.mkdir(tmpdir) try: with fileutils.remove_path_on_error( tmpdir, lambda path: fileutils.delete_if_exists(path, os.rmdir)): raise Exception except Exception: self.assertFalse(os.path.exists(tmpdir))

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError if pagination query be called for Hbase

It is part of bp/paginate-db-search.

Implements blueprint paginate-db-search

Change-Id: Ie6ee96570139f2273ce329d17d722ed176b28268

subject: Adding Read-Only volume attaching support to Cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-23 16:25:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9a8547163101bdd0f0dbc56faaeb1ae92a2c287a', 'message': "Adding Read-Only volume attaching support to Cinder

1. Adding an API extension to allow client set volume Read-Only flag on
demand.
2. Require client give/aware volume attaching mode when they call
'os-attach' API.
3. Adding a 'access_mode' field to connection info which
'os-initialize_connection' API returned. This field should be used by
client such as Nova to use correct mode accessing attached volume.
Currently access mode can be 'rw' or 'ro'.
4. In feature, the driver within Cinder need to ensure the volume be
exposed under the correct access mode which connection info described,
for exampl backend should set volume to readonly mode when connection
info ask client using 'ro' access mode consume attached volume. That
means Read-Only is not only a attaching mode but also a status for a
volume.

blueprint read-only-volumes

Change-Id: I4c84614d6541d5f7c358abadb957da7b8c3d9c48
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-24 05:33:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/9cd9c47130846fd59aa8483d10d6ffca0a745b14', 'message': "Adding Read-Only volume attaching support to Cinder

demand.
2. Require client to provide and be aware of volume attaching mode when
they call 'os-attach' API.
3. Adding a 'access_mode' field to connection info which
'os-initialize_connection' API returned. This field should be used by
client such as Nova to use correct mode accessing attached volume.
Currently access mode can be 'rw' or 'ro'.
4. In future, the driver within Cinder need to ensure the volume be
exposed under the correct access mode which connection info described,
for example backend should set volume to readonly mode when connection
info ask client using 'ro' access mode consume attached volume. That
means Read-Only is not only a attaching mode but also a status for a
volume.

blueprint read-only-volumes

exposed under the correct access mode which connection info described,
for example backend should set volume to readonly mode when connection
info ask client using 'ro' access mode consume attached volume. That
means Read-Only is not only a attaching mode but also a status for a
volume.

blueprint read-only-volumes

commit_message:
Adding Read-Only volume attaching support to Cinder

1. Adding an API extension to allow clients set volume Read-Only flag on
demand.
2. Require client to provide and be aware of volume attaching mode when
they call 'os-attach' API.
3. Adding a 'access_mode' field to connection info which
'os-initialize_connection' API returned. This field should be used by
client such as Nova to use correct mode accessing attached volume.
Currently access mode can be 'rw' or 'ro'.
4. In future, the driver within Cinder need to ensure the volume be
exposed under the correct access mode which connection info described,
for example backend should set volume to readonly mode when connection
info ask client using 'ro' access mode consume attached volume. That
means Read-Only is not only a attaching mode but also a status for a
volume.

blueprint read-only-volumes

Change-Id: I4c84614d6541d5f7c358abadb957da7b8c3d9c48
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/22/38322/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mountpoint, mode): :access_mode: the volume access mode allow client used ('rw' or 'ro' currently supported) access_mode = volume['attached_mode'] if access_mode is None: # NOTE(zhiyan): client didn't call 'os-attach' before access_mode = 'ro' if volume['readonly'] else 'rw' properties['access_mode'] = access_mode 'access_mode': 'rw' # TODO(zhiyan): adding ACL code for readonly attaching # in LioAdm helper if needed. 'data': {'access_mode': 'rw'} 'access_mode': 'rw' 'access_mode': 'rw'
deleted_lines: mountpoint): host_device = None protocol = connection['driver_volume_type'] 'data': {}

commit_message:
Add event for device remove

this is a very draft event process for device remove:

1.change the event framework to  a nofiy chain, so
libvirt itself can recive the intresting event.

2.a python event is setup, when detach the pci device
we wait on it to complete.

in this way, we got event to ensure the device is remove
before we go on...

XXXX problem:
1) i setup libvirt in ubuntu, and dev stack, there is no event
support ....  so no on hardware testing be done

2) use libvirt event like this seems broken the event process logic
: now, we recive event only in compute node, and only support
one listener.

--------------------------------
there can be done in another way,

1) libvirt do the detach and return,
2) compoute node receive the detach event, and wait there.
3) this method keep current event frame no change.

in either way, seems we might need talk a got...

Change-Id: I23a368d4b7017343783e1b8a35ad383d00eb9031
signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/44233/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # libvirt event listener chain self._compute_event_callback = [] self._compute_event_callback.append(callback) if len(self._compute_event_callback) < 1: for cb in self._compute_event_callback: cb(event)
deleted_lines: self._compute_event_callback = None self._compute_event_callback = callback if not self._compute_event_callback: self._compute_event_callback(event)

commit_message:
Add large-ops option to tox

Add new option because we want to keep separate tox jobs for each
jenkins job.

Part of the regression test for bug 1199433.

Change-Id: I4e59d79d3ce3a9621243a81b7da5d9c3abaf1d6f

commit_message:
Hide form tooltip when form closes on escape key

Fixes #1215277

Form tooltips used in every form.
After form closes on escape button tooltip stays on screen
until the page is refreshed.
This fix listen escape key pressing and close opened tooltip.

Change-Id: Ie01336787a3bd11ed967e085ee7dda4616441cc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/44/43244/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: // Hide the tooltip after escape button pressed $(document).on('keydown.esc_btn', function (evt) { if (evt.keyCode == 27) { $('.tooltip').hide(); } });

commit_message:
change 'Host' object's 'host' attribute to 'host_name'

The function __repr__ of Host class which is located in hosts.py try to
access 'host' attribute, source code is "self.host",But in fact, Host object
don't has this attribute, it should be 'host_name'! We can find this attribute
from nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/hosts.py file.

So I simply change 'self.host' to 'self.host_name'.

Change-Id: Ie76ba04da7592a596ab728fec981e9a1dbcc6a5f
Fixes: bug 1210043
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/24/40824/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return "<Host: %s>" % self.host_name
deleted_lines: return "<Host: %s>" % self.host

commit_message:
Clean up some of the proxy unit tests.

Since we've got machinery to catch HTTPException errors that happens
after the proxy server's __call__ method but before the individual
GET()/POST()/etc. methods, we shouldn't just call
GET()/POST()/etc. Instead, we should use swob.Request's get_response()
method, or otherwise actually call the proxy application. That way we
can have the code raise HTTPBadRequest, but the test just gets a
plain old response with a 400 status code, just like you'd expect.

Earlier changes fixed some of the tests; this commit fixes some
more. In the interest of not having a gigantic diff, this only gets
about half the proxy's unit tests, and the others will be done in a
subsequent commit.

Change-Id: Iaca32e74a8f4499440e655c207a1012e14486c74

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack LLC. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Attach open standard audit information to request.environ AuditMiddleware filter should be place after Keystone's auth_token middleware in the pipeline so that it can utilise the information Keystone provides. """ from pycadf.audit import api as cadf_api from ceilometer.openstack.common.middleware import notifier class AuditMiddleware(notifier.RequestNotifier): def __init__(self, app, **conf): super(AuditMiddleware, self).__init__(app, **conf) self.cadf_audit = cadf_api.OpenStackAuditApi() @notifier.log_and_ignore_error def process_request(self, request): self.cadf_audit.append_audit_event(request) super(AuditMiddleware, self).process_request(request) @notifier.log_and_ignore_error def process_response(self, request, response, exception=None, traceback=None): self.cadf_audit.mod_audit_event(request, response) super(AuditMiddleware, self).process_response(request, response, exception, traceback)

commit_message:
Fix HTTP response for PortInUse during boot (v3 API)

If an in use port is passed as a network parameter in the request, Nova API
should raise an HTTPConflict (409) error. This was fixed in commit
48b31c9a1f5d2a45d881e70c6223411c5abbcb72 for the V2 API but not the V3 API.

Fixes bug 1212098

Change-Id: I94429f2c04cf81cb88a8739f65a49aa7ca0d49bd

commit_message:
Fix test_admin_catalog_list

This commit fixes test_admin_catalog_list() so that it tests more
specific details of the admin catalog. It also removes the test's
dependency on each table in the output having a service label. This
dependency was occasionally causing a failure if the test ran at the
same time as the keystone api tests.

Fixes bug 1217159

Change-Id: I4446abb86a3f1f6514fc9de1d00c06f82943b9d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/78/44178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add /usr/sbin and /sbin to $PATH route

Depending on the system configuration, /usr/sbin and /sbin can be not
available to the user executing the script, and failing to boot
the seed image due to the missing route to the arp command.

In Fedora, Ubuntu and Debian arp is located in /usr/sbin, meanwhile
in Centos it's located in /sbin .

Change-Id: I34be00348626205929329962d7e2998b4dca55f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/59/44259/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PATH=$PATH:/usr/sbin:/sbin

subject: Adding RBAC policy system and checks for identity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-19 20:13:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/c401601f9f4108fb59e265f1c50c47dc872b5c0f', 'message': "Adding RBAC policy system and checks for identity

Adding file based RBAC engine for Horizon using copies of nova and
keystone policy.json files

Policy engine builds on top of oslo incubator policy.py, fileutils
was also pulled from oslo incubator as a dependency of policy.py

When Horizon runs and a policy check is made, a path and mapping of
services to policy files is used to load the rules into the policy
engine.  Each check is mapped to a service type and validated.  This
extra level of mapping is required because the policy.json files
may each contain a 'default' rule or unqualified (no service name
include) rule.  Additionally, maintaining separate policy.json
files per service will allow easier syncing with the service
projects.

The engine allows for compound 'and' checks at this time.  E.g.,
the way the Create User action is written, multiple APIs are
called to read data (roles, projects) and more are required to
update data (grants, user).

Other workflows e.g., Edit Project,  should have separate save
actions per step as they are unrelated.  Only the applicable
policy checks to that step were added.  The separating unrelated
steps saves will should be future work.

The underlying engine supports more rule types that are used in the
underlying policy.json files.

Policy checks were added for all actions on tables in the Identity
Panel only.  And the service policy files imported are limited in
this commit to reduce scope of the change.

Finally, the benefit Horizon has is that the underlying APIs will
correct us if we get it wrong, so if a policy file is not found for
a particular service, permission is assumed and the actual API call
to the service will fail if the action isn't authorized for that user.

Implements: blueprint rbac

Change-Id: I4a4a71163186b973229a0461b165c16936bc10e5

Adding file based RBAC engine for Horizon using copies of nova and
keystone policy.json files

Policy engine builds on top of oslo incubator policy.py, fileutils
was also pulled from oslo incubator as a dependency of policy.py

When Horizon runs and a policy check is made, a path and mapping of
services to policy files is used to load the rules into the policy
engine.  Each check is mapped to a service type and validated.  This
extra level of mapping is required because the policy.json files
may each contain a 'default' rule or unqualified (no service name

The engine allows for compound 'and' checks at this time.  E.g.,
the way the Create User action is written, multiple APIs are

The underlying engine supports more rule types that are used in the
underlying policy.json files.

Policy checks were added for all actions on tables in the Identity
Panel only.  And the service policy files imported are limited in
this commit to reduce scope of the change.

Additionally, changes were made to the base action class to add
support or setting policy rules and an overridable method for
determining the policy check target. This reduces the need for
redundant code in each action policy check.

Note, the benefit Horizon has is that the underlying APIs will
correct us if we get it wrong, so if a policy file is not found for
a particular service, permission is assumed and the actual API call
to the service will fail if the action isn't authorized for that user.

Other workflows e.g., Edit Project,  should have separate save
actions per step as they are unrelated.  Only the applicable
policy checks to that step were added.  The separating unrelated
steps saves will should be future work.

The underlying engine supports more rule types that are used in the
underlying policy.json files.

Policy checks were added for all actions on tables in the Identity
Panel only.  And the service policy files imported are limited in
this commit to reduce scope of the change.

Additionally, changes were made to the base action class to add
support or setting policy rules and an overridable method for
determining the policy check target. This reduces the need for
redundant code in each action policy check.

Note, the benefit Horizon has is that the underlying APIs will
correct us if we get it wrong, so if a policy file is not found for
a particular service, permission is assumed and the actual API call
to the service will fail if the action isn't authorized for that user.

Finally, adding documentation regarding policy enforcement.

Implements: blueprint rbac

Change-Id: I4a4a71163186b973229a0461b165c16936bc10e5

commit_message:
Adding RBAC policy system and checks for identity

Adding file based RBAC engine for Horizon using copies of nova and
keystone policy.json files

Policy engine builds on top of oslo incubator policy.py, fileutils
was also pulled from oslo incubator as a dependency of policy.py

When Horizon runs and a policy check is made, a path and mapping of
services to policy files is used to load the rules into the policy
engine.  Each check is mapped to a service type and validated.  This
extra level of mapping is required because the policy.json files
may each contain a 'default' rule or unqualified (no service name
include) rule.  Additionally, maintaining separate policy.json
files per service will allow easier syncing with the service
projects.

The engine allows for compound 'and' checks at this time.  E.g.,
the way the Create User action is written, multiple APIs are
called to read data (roles, projects) and more are required to
update data (grants, user).

Other workflows e.g., Edit Project,  should have separate save
actions per step as they are unrelated.  Only the applicable
policy checks to that step were added.  The separating unrelated
steps saves will should be future work.

The underlying engine supports more rule types that are used in the
underlying policy.json files.

Policy checks were added for all actions on tables in the Identity
Panel only.  And the service policy files imported are limited in
this commit to reduce scope of the change.

Additionally, changes were made to the base action class to add
support or setting policy rules and an overridable method for
determining the policy check target. This reduces the need for
redundant code in each action policy check.

Note, the benefit Horizon has is that the underlying APIs will
correct us if we get it wrong, so if a policy file is not found for
a particular service, permission is assumed and the actual API call
to the service will fail if the action isn't authorized for that user.

Finally, adding documentation regarding policy enforcement.

Implements: blueprint rbac

Change-Id: I4a4a71163186b973229a0461b165c16936bc10e5

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2011 OpenStack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import contextlib import errno import os from openstack_dashboard.openstack.common import excutils from openstack_dashboard.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ # noqa from openstack_dashboard.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) _FILE_CACHE = {} def ensure_tree(path): """Create a directory (and any ancestor directories required) :param path: Directory to create """ try: os.makedirs(path) except OSError as exc: if exc.errno == errno.EEXIST: if not os.path.isdir(path): raise else: raise def read_cached_file(filename, force_reload=False): """Read from a file if it has been modified. :param force_reload: Whether to reload the file. :returns: A tuple with a boolean specifying if the data is fresh or not. """ global _FILE_CACHE if force_reload and filename in _FILE_CACHE: del _FILE_CACHE[filename] reloaded = False mtime = os.path.getmtime(filename) cache_info = _FILE_CACHE.setdefault(filename, {}) if not cache_info or mtime > cache_info.get('mtime', 0): LOG.debug(_("Reloading cached file %s") % filename) with open(filename) as fap: cache_info['data'] = fap.read() cache_info['mtime'] = mtime reloaded = True return (reloaded, cache_info['data']) def delete_if_exists(path): """Delete a file, but ignore file not found error. :param path: File to delete """ try: os.unlink(path) except OSError as e: if e.errno == errno.ENOENT: return else: raise @contextlib.contextmanager def remove_path_on_error(path): """Protect code that wants to operate on PATH atomically. Any exception will cause PATH to be removed. :param path: File to work with """ try: yield except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): delete_if_exists(path) def file_open(*args, **kwargs): """Open file see built-in file() documentation for more details Note: The reason this is kept in a separate module is to easily be able to provide a stub module that doesn't alter system state at all (for unit tests) """ return file(*args, **kwargs)

added_lines: local line # No section name specified # Check if section already exists if [ ! grep -q "^\[$section\]" "$file" ]; then # Add section at the end echo -e "\n[$section]" >>"$file" fi # Check if parameter in the section exists line=$(sed -ne "/^\[$section\]/,/^\[.*\]/ { /^$option[ \t]*=/ p; }" "$file") if [ -z "$line" ] ; then # Add parameter if it is not exists sed -i -e "/^\[$section\]/ a\\ $option = $value " "$file" else # Replace existing parameter sed -i -e "/^\[$section\]/,/^\[.*\]/ s|^\($option[ \t]*=[ \t]*\).*$|\1$value|" "$file" fi if [ "$SSL_ENABLED" = 'true' ] ; then case "$config_file" in '/etc/murano-api/murano-api.conf') iniset 'ssl' 'cert_file' '/etc/murano-api/server.crt' "$config_file" iniset 'ssl' 'key_file' '/etc/murano-api/server.key' "$config_file" ;; '/etc/murano-api/murano-api-paste.ini') iniset 'filter:authtoken' 'auth_protocol' 'https' "$config_file" ;; '/etc/murano-conductor/conductor.conf') iniset 'keystone' 'insecure' 'True' "$config_file" iniset 'heat' 'insecure' 'True' "$config_file" ;; esac fi# Only 'true' or 'false' values are allowed! commit_message:
Use common create_keypair method for autoscaling

The scenario test for autoscaling was implemented at the same time
with cleanup patch of create_keypair methods, and the cleanup patch
could not cover autoscaling test.
This patch covers autoscaling test.

Change-Id: Ibf4e98a9d4616c1dc6d2f08bde3d04a40b910067

Change-Id: I55cc0cb6cc791708c9b8038787d712760f9515df

commit_message:
Adds else and TODO in statistics storage tests

Fixes bug #1217688

Addresses minor issues that were raised in the code review comments
for Patch Set 10 of "Add SQLAlchemy implementation of groupby"
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41597/

The issues were in the StatisticsGroupByTest class of the storage
driver tests.

1) Adds else clause to test_group_by_with_query_filter_multiple

   The else clause ensures that all possible values for 'project_id'
   and 'resource_id' are covered when checking the values returned
   by get_meter_statistics().

2) Adds TODO comments for tests that are not implemented

   The tests that have not been implemented are ones involving
   metadata fields, since group by with metadata fields has not yet
   been implemented.

Change-Id: I55cc0cb6cc791708c9b8038787d712760f9515df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/93/43993/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_metadata needs to be implemented. # This test should check grouping by a single metadata field. # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_multiple_metadata needs to be # implemented. # This test should check grouping by multiple metadata fields. # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_multiple_regular_metadata needs to be # implemented. # This test should check grouping by a combination of regular and # metadata fields. # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_metadata_with_query_filter needs to be # implemented. # This test should check grouping by a metadata field in combination # with a query filter. else: self.assertNotEqual(r.groupby, {'project_id': 'project-2', 'resource_id': 'resource-1'}) # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_metadata_with_query_filter_multiple needs # to be implemented. # This test should check grouping by multiple metadata fields in # combination with a query filter. # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_metadata_with_period needs to be # implemented. # This test should check grouping by metadata fields in combination # with period grouping. # TODO(terriyu) test_group_by_metadata_with_query_filter_and_period # needs to be implemented. # This test should check grouping with metadata fields in combination # with a query filter and period grouping.

commit_message:
Introduce Invalid* EC2 error codes

ec2_code attribute with valid EC2 error code was added to several
Nova exceptions to allow simple error code mapping in EC2 API.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes

Change-Id: Ica5cdf4a9662b4b569ded1f1b1931b9a3cdaa9f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/41748/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keypairs = ','.join(key_name) raise exception.InvalidKeyPairNotFoundEC2(keypair=keypairs) raise exception.InvalidPermissionDuplicateEC2( rule=values_for_rule) raise exception.InvalidGroupDuplicateEC2(message=msg)
deleted_lines: msg = _('Could not find key pair(s): %s') % ','.join(key_name) raise exception.KeypairNotFound(msg, code="InvalidKeyPair.Duplicate") err = _('%s - This rule already exists in group') raise exception.EC2APIError(err % values_for_rule) raise exception.EC2APIError(message=msg)

commit_message:
Add db.block_device_mapping_get_by_id

Add a new db API method for getting a block device mapping for a given
volume ID.  This is needed when Cinder calls over to Nova asking nova to
complete a snapshot operation on its behalf.

Related to blueprint qemu-assisted-snapshots

Change-Id: If3f011e2db14235f4137c9d9cb610f0c4cd7954a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/42768/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def block_device_mapping_get_by_volume_id(context, volume_id): return _block_device_mapping_get_query(context).\ filter_by(volume_id=volume_id).\ first() @require_context

commit_message:
Add volume snapshot APIs to driver interface

Add volume_snapshot_create and volume_snapshot_delete to the virt driver
interface.  This is needed to be able to do hypervisor assisted snapshot
operations.

Part of blueprint qemu-assisted-snapshots

Change-Id: I933e000ee56430365f9e380196714f43a85f147f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/42767/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def volume_snapshot_create(self, context, instance, volume_id, connection_info): """ Snapshots volumes attached to a specified instance. :param context: request context :param instance: Instance object that has the volume attached :param volume_id: Volume to be snapshotted :param connection_info: The data needed for nova to be able to attach to the volume. This is the same data format returned by Cinder's initialize_connection() API call. In the case of doing a snapshot, it is the image file Cinder expects to be used as the active disk after the snapshot operation has completed. """ raise NotImplementedError() def volume_snapshot_delete(self, context, instance, volume_id, snapshot_id, delete_info): """ Snapshots volumes attached to a specified instance. :param context: request context :param instance: Instance object that has the volume attached :param volume_id: Attached volume associated with the snapshot :param snapshot_id: The snapshot to delete. :param delete_info: Volume backend technology specific data needed to be able to complete the snapshot. For example, in the case of qcow2 backed snapshots, this would include the file being merged, and the file being merged into (if appropriate). """ raise NotImplementedError()

commit_message:
Fix CFN API error responses

A remote exception (included in conf.allowed_rpc_exception_modules)
is now restored to a subclass of its original type (with the
exception of non heap types which will always be restored to its
original type). Catching rpc_common.RemoteError is not enough
anymore.

Fixes bug #1214831

Change-Id: Iae3ce0c9d0d3f6565fab25ec899f83f19d46e81b

commit_message:
Fix the Domain context for Projects panel

Add display of Domain ID and Domain Name in the Create and Update
Projects page to give user a hint where the Project will be created.
For Keystone V2, the two fields will be hidden.

When the Domain Context is set, the Project will be created in that
Domain Context. Otherwise, the Project will be created in the Domain
of the logon user.

On project creation, the listing of available users and groups will
be based on the Domain where it will be created. While on project
update, the listing of available users and groups will be based on
the Domain of the Project.

Fixes bug 1215196

Change-Id: Ia2ab25956621d01c2173e08402241b7f60401e0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/86/43386/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_default_domain(request): """ Gets the default domain object to use when creating Identity object. Returns the domain context if is set, otherwise return the domain of the logon user. """ domain_id = request.session.get("domain_context", None) domain_name = request.session.get("domain_context_name", None) # if running in Keystone V3 or later if VERSIONS.active >= 3 and not domain_id: # if no domain context set, default to users' domain domain_id = request.user.user_domain_id try: domain = domain_get(request, domain_id) domain_name = domain.name except Exception: LOG.warning("Unable to retrieve Domain: %s" % domain_id) domain = base.APIDictWrapper({"id": domain_id, "name": domain_name}) return domain

commit_message:
Implement assignment of Domain Roles to Group

Added Domain Groups step in the Domain Update workflow for managing
domain-role assignment to Groups.

Change-Id: I882f9213ab8d72032d542dc45558e9479a86741e
Implements: blueprint group-domain-role-assignment

commit_message:
Deprecate conductor migration_create()

Converts the 1 use of conductor migration_create() to use the object
model, instead.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I5d8cf38d10d1092f2890b4f381337d188f4a7cf2

added_lines: from nova.objects import migration as migration_obj migration = self._create_migration(context, instance_ref, instance_type) return claims.NopClaim(migration=migration) migration = self._create_migration(context, instance_ref, instance_type) claim.migration = migration self.compute_node, migration) migration = migration_obj.Migration() migration.dest_compute = self.host migration.dest_node = self.nodename migration.dest_host = self.driver.get_host_ip_addr() migration.old_instance_type_id = old_instance_type['id'] migration.new_instance_type_id = instance_type['id'] migration.status = 'pre-migrating' migration.instance_uuid = instance['uuid'] migration.source_compute = instance['host'] migration.source_node = instance['node'] migration.create(context.elevated()) return migration
deleted_lines: migration_ref = self._create_migration(context, instance_ref, instance_type) return claims.NopClaim(migration=migration_ref) migration_ref = self._create_migration(context, instance_ref, instance_type) claim.migration = migration_ref self.compute_node, migration_ref) return self.conductor_api.migration_create(context, instance, {'dest_compute': self.host, 'dest_node': self.nodename, 'dest_host': self.driver.get_host_ip_addr(), 'old_instance_type_id': old_instance_type['id'], 'new_instance_type_id': instance_type['id'], 'status': 'pre-migrating'})

commit_message:
Make backup and snapshot use objects

This makes the backup and snapshot paths use objects.  To make things
cleaner for syncing compute rpcapi and cells rpcapi, the
single snapshot_instance rpc method that was used for both snapshot and
backup has been split into backup_instance and snapshot_instance.  The
appropriate cells versions have been added.

The backup and snapshot tests have also been converted into unit tests and
moved into test_compute_api.py.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ibdaee07290cf8d61c106702aa7068dd308bc9aac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/42665/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extra_properties=None): :param name: name of the backup :param backup_type: 'daily' or 'weekly' when creating the image. image_meta = self._create_image(context, instance, name, 'backup', backup_type=backup_type, rotation=rotation, extra_properties=extra_properties) # NOTE(comstud): Any changes to this method should also be made # to the backup_instance() method in nova/cells/messaging.py instance.task_state = task_states.IMAGE_BACKUP instance.save(expected_task_state=None) self.compute_rpcapi.backup_instance(context, instance, image_meta['id'], backup_type, rotation) def snapshot(self, context, instance, name, extra_properties=None): :param name: name of the snapshot when creating the image. image_meta = self._create_image(context, instance, name, 'snapshot', extra_properties=extra_properties) # NOTE(comstud): Any changes to this method should also be made # to the snapshot_instance() method in nova/cells/messaging.py instance.task_state = task_states.IMAGE_SNAPSHOT instance.save(expected_task_state=None) self.compute_rpcapi.snapshot_instance(context, instance, image_meta['id'])
deleted_lines: extra_properties=None, image_id=None): :param name: name of the backup or snapshot name = backup_type # daily backups are called 'daily' if image_id: # The image entry has already been created, so just pull the # metadata. image_meta = self.image_service.show(context, image_id) else: image_meta = self._create_image(context, instance, name, 'backup', backup_type=backup_type, rotation=rotation, extra_properties=extra_properties) instance = self.update(context, instance, task_state=task_states.IMAGE_BACKUP, expected_task_state=None) self.compute_rpcapi.snapshot_instance(context, instance=instance, image_id=image_meta['id'], image_type='backup', backup_type=backup_type, rotation=rotation) def snapshot(self, context, instance, name, extra_properties=None, image_id=None): :param name: name of the backup or snapshot if image_id: # The image entry has already been created, so just pull the # metadata. image_meta = self.image_service.show(context, image_id) else: image_meta = self._create_image(context, instance, name, 'snapshot', extra_properties=extra_properties) instance = self.update(context, instance, task_state=task_states.IMAGE_SNAPSHOT, expected_task_state=None) self.compute_rpcapi.snapshot_instance(context, instance=instance, image_id=image_meta['id'], image_type='snapshot')

commit_message:
Make inject_network_info use objects

Makes the inject_network_info path use instance object.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I8d6b90cac0c1f638b623def319f676e95b416e09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/42673/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Convert reset_network to use instance object

Converts all calls to reset_network to use objects.  Also adds the
cells rpcapi methods to match compute rpcapi and ditches the special
cells code in compute/cells_api.py

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: If4da142864cbe993a7cc852358e3b27bd8c02629
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/42346/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1.22 - Adds reset_network() def reset_network(self, ctxt, instance): """Reset networking for an instance.""" if not CONF.cells.enable: return self.cast(ctxt, self.make_msg('reset_network', instance=instance), version='1.22')

commit_message:
Make compute_api use objects for lock/unlock

Converts compute_api.lock and unlock to require objects and modifies the
callers to pass them.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ice8361328cdfeb92207c778beb07b55a9d4eda8d

commit_message:
Proof of concept of kexec/takeovernode

Exploration of the possibility of reusing a node by pulling down a
known image and blowing away the contents of the current running
machine.

Change-Id: I2de449b867c802a9235984935fd9bad0490ecf6c

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Reuse a devstack VM. # Copyright (C) 2011-2012 OpenStack LLC. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import os import sys import vmdatabase import utils NODE_NAME = sys.argv[1] UPSTREAM_BUILD_URL = os.environ.get('UPSTREAM_BUILD_URL', '') UPSTREAM_JOB_NAME = os.environ.get('UPSTREAM_JOB_NAME', '') UPSTREAM_BRANCH = os.environ.get('UPSTREAM_BRANCH', '') BUILD_URL = os.environ.get('BUILD_URL', '') def main(): db = vmdatabase.VMDatabase() machine = db.getMachineByJenkinsName(NODE_NAME) try: client = utils.ssh_connect(machine.ip, 'ubuntu') client.ssh( 'Installing qemu-utils and kexec', 'sudo DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get' ' --option "Dpkg::Options::=--force-confold"' ' --assume-yes install qemu-utils kexec-tools') client.ssh( 'Grabbing image', 'curl -o /tmp/devstack-gate-precise.qcow2' ' https://tarballs.openstack.org/devstack-gate-precise.qcow2') client.ssh( "Modprobe nbd", 'sudo modprobe nbd max_part=16') client.ssh( 'Cleaning newimage', 'sudo rm -rf /tmp/newimage') client.ssh( 'Making newimage directory', 'sudo mkdir -p /tmp/newimage') client.ssh( 'Processing image', 'sudo qemu-nbd -c /dev/nbd1 /tmp/devstack-gate-precise.qcow2') client.ssh( 'Mounting image', 'sudo mount /dev/nbd1 /tmp/newimage') client.ssh('Cleaning recover', 'sudo rm -rf /tmp/recover') client.ssh('Making recovery dir', 'sudo mkdir -p /tmp/recover/ssh') client.ssh( 'Copying host files', 'sudo cp -ta /tmp/recover /etc/mtab /etc/hosts') client.ssh( 'Copying ssh key', 'sudo cp -a /etc/ssh/ssh_host_*key* /tmp/recover/ssh') client.ssh( 'Blowing away the old system', 'rsync -axHAXv /tmp/newimage/ / --exclude=/tmp --delete-after') client.ssh('Restoring host files', 'sudo cp -at /etc /tmp/recover/*') client.ssh('Updating grub', 'sudo update-grub') client.ssh('Installing grub', 'sudo grub-install /dev/vda') client.ssh( 'Enabling kexec', 'sudo sed -i /etc/default/kexec' ' -e s/LOAD_KEXEC=false/LOAD_KEXEC=true/') client.ssh( 'Loading kexec', 'sudo kexec -l /vmlinuz --initrd=/initrd.img' ' --append="`cat /proc/cmdline`"') client.ssh( 'Hard reboot', 'sudo nohup bash -c "sleep 2; kexec -e"' ' </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 &') machine.state = vmdatabase.READY db.commit() except: pass if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Add eclipse project files to .gitignore

Like some of the other projects (nova, cinder, heat, oslo) git ignore
eclipse project files. This will remove manual steps for people
developing from eclipse.

Change-Id: Ib908c8d419072b440f5ec647bea8f13b97e48f7c

subject: Use pbr AUTHORS generation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-14 22:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['AUTHORS.in', '.gitignore', 'AUTHORS', 'setup.cfg', 'MANIFEST.in'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c7352588ae09927d0dfcf62fa911a37c0f2ced78', 'message': 'Use pbr AUTHORS generation

pbr has a feature to generate AUTHORS files at sdist time from the git
commit logs. swift, however, has a header section that the project likes
at the top of the file. Recent pbr supports keeping that information in
an AUTHORS.in file and will pre-pend it to the generated output.

Move the AUTHORS file to AUTHORS.in, remove the info that can come from
the git log, and enable the flag for the feature in pbr.

Change-Id: Icd882c3426b4f166b2e75a7f1d425e4c13962e52
'}]
commit_message:
Use pbr AUTHORS generation

pbr has a feature to generate AUTHORS files at sdist time from the git
commit logs. swift, however, has a header section that the project likes
at the top of the file. Recent pbr supports keeping that information in
an AUTHORS.in file and will pre-pend it to the generated output.

Move the AUTHORS file to AUTHORS.in, remove the info that can come from
the git log, and enable the flag for the feature in pbr.

Change-Id: Icd882c3426b4f166b2e75a7f1d425e4c13962e52

commit_message:
Add affinity availability zone scheduler filter.

Create an new filter to schedule the instance on a same/different availability
zone of a set of instances. And add some tests for the filter.

DocImpact

Implemented bp: different-availability-zone-filter

Change-Id: I948d8cf6ad5bab8db82398fb3aa7797a49acdc5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/28669/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import availability_zones as az class BaseAvailabilityZoneFilter(AffinityFilter): def _get_instance_availability_zones(self, context, instance_uuids): instances = self.compute_api.get_all(context, {'uuid': instance_uuids, 'deleted': False}) return set([az.get_instance_availability_zone(context, inst) for inst in instances]) def _get_host_availability_zone(self, context, host): elevated = context.elevated() return az.get_host_availability_zone(elevated, host) class SameAvailabilityZoneFilter(BaseAvailabilityZoneFilter): """Schedule the instance on a same availability zone of a set of instances. """ def host_passes(self, host_state, filter_properties): context = filter_properties['context'] scheduler_hints = filter_properties.get('scheduler_hints') or {} affinity_uuids = scheduler_hints.get('same_availability_zone', []) if isinstance(affinity_uuids, basestring): affinity_uuids = [affinity_uuids] if affinity_uuids: azs = self._get_instance_availability_zones(context, affinity_uuids) my_az = self._get_host_availability_zone(context, host_state.host) return my_az in azs return True class DifferentAvailabilityZoneFilter(BaseAvailabilityZoneFilter): """Schedule the instance on a different availability zone of a set of instances. """ def host_passes(self, host_state, filter_properties): context = filter_properties['context'] scheduler_hints = filter_properties.get('scheduler_hints') or {} affinity_uuids = scheduler_hints.get('different_availability_zone', []) if isinstance(affinity_uuids, basestring): affinity_uuids = [affinity_uuids] if affinity_uuids: azs = self._get_instance_availability_zones(context, affinity_uuids) my_az = self._get_host_availability_zone(context, host_state.host) return my_az not in azs return True

commit_message:
IBM storwize_svc driver change for FC zone mgr testing

This is a WIP patch to help with the testing of FC zone
manager. The initialize_connection and terminate_connection
code has been changed to return initiator_target_map.

See review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41772/ and
BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-fc-zone-manager
for details.

remove the zone as well if volume is fibre-channel attached if vol_opts['protocol'].lower() == 'fibre_channel': conn_wwpns = self._get_conn_fc_wwpns(host_name) preferred_node_entry = \ self._get_preferred_node_entry(volume_name) if not vol_opts['multipath']: if (preferred_node_entry and preferred_node_entry['WWPN'] in conn_wwpns): target_wwpns = preferred_node_entry['WWPN'] else: target_wwpns = conn_wwpns[0] else: target_wwpns = conn_wwpns initiator_wwpns = connector['wwpns'] target_wwpns = map(_add_colons, target_wwpns) initiator_target_map = dict(map(lambda x: (x, target_wwpns), initiator_wwpns)) info = {'driver_volume_type': 'fibre_channel', 'data': {'target_discovered': True, 'target_wwpn': target_wwpns, 'initiator_target_map': initiator_target_map}}

commit_message:
Add support for pip to source-repositories

Adds a pip type to the source-repositories interface. elements
installing from pip can use this to allow the process running di-b
override source location.

Still a WIP, TODO :
    a bit more testing
    implement caching (when DIB_OFFLINE is set)

Change-Id: I4a8c844f58cea979e96671b7216718be3bfc66cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/22/40622/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local REGEX="^([^ ]+) (git|tar|pip) (/[^ ]+) ([^ ]+) ?([^ ]*)$" pip) local tmpdir=$(mktemp --tmpdir=$TMP_MOUNT_PATH/tmp -d) # This is defaulted to master for git, reset it back if not being used to # set a package version [ "$REPOREF" = "master" ] && REPOREF= PIP_EXTRA_FLAGS= # If DIB_PIP_INDEX is set then use it as the default package index for pip # The override it if explicitly set for a particular package if [ -n "${DIB_PIP_INDEX:-}" ] ; then PIP_EXTRA_FLAGS="--index-url $DIB_PIP_INDEX" fi if [ "$REPOLOCATION" != "-" ] ; then PIP_EXTRA_FLAGS="--index-url $REPOLOCATION" fi pip install --no-deps --no-install --download $tmpdir $PIP_EXTRA_FLAGS $REPONAME$REPOREF tar -C $tmpdir -xzf $(find $tmpdir -type f) sudo mkdir -p $REPO_DIRECTORY sudo mv $tmpdir/*/* $REPO_DIRECTORY rm -rf $tmpdir ;;

commit_message:
Fixes race cond between delete and confirm resize

If we delete an instance after a confirming resize operation,
and if the instance is deleted firstly at the dest compute node,
then the *_resize dir and network info of this instance will be
left alone on the source compute node, never be cleaned up.
Please refer the bug page to get the reproduce steps.

Fixes bug 1202484

Change-Id: I1daa432c17ff8bd62e05f8e23503459953bb45d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/37836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance['vm_state'] == vm_states.RESIZED: self._confirm_resize_on_deleting(context, instance) def _confirm_resize_on_deleting(self, context, instance): # If in the middle of a resize, use confirm_resize to # ensure the original instance is cleaned up too get_migration = self.db.migration_get_by_instance_and_status migration_ref = None for status in ('finished', 'confirming'): try: migration_ref = get_migration(context.elevated(), instance['uuid'], status) if migration_ref: LOG.info(_('Found an unconfirmed migration during delete, ' 'id: %(id)s, status: %(status)s') % {'id': migration_ref['id'], 'status': migration_ref['status']}, context=context, instance=instance) break except exception.MigrationNotFoundByStatus: pass if not migration_ref: LOG.info(_('Instance may have been confirmed during delete'), context=context, instance=instance) return src_host = migration_ref['source_compute'] # Call since this can race with the terminate_instance. # The resize is done but awaiting confirmation/reversion, # so there are two cases: # 1. up-resize: here -instance['vcpus'/'memory_mb'] match # the quota usages accounted for this instance, # so no further quota adjustment is needed # 2. down-resize: here -instance['vcpus'/'memory_mb'] are # shy by delta(old, new) from the quota usages accounted # for this instance, so we must adjust try: deltas = self._downsize_quota_delta(context, instance) except KeyError: LOG.info(_('Migration %s may have been confirmed during delete') % migration_ref['id'], context=context, instance=instance) return downsize_reservations = self._reserve_quota_delta(context, deltas) self._record_action_start(context, instance, instance_actions.CONFIRM_RESIZE) self.compute_rpcapi.confirm_resize(context, instance, migration_ref, host=src_host, cast=False, reservations=downsize_reservations, is_delete=True) @check_instance_state(vm_state=[vm_states.RESIZED], task_state=[None])
deleted_lines: if instance['vm_state'] == vm_states.RESIZED: # If in the middle of a resize, use confirm_resize to # ensure the original instance is cleaned up too get_migration = self.db.migration_get_by_instance_and_status try: migration_ref = get_migration(context.elevated(), instance['uuid'], 'finished') except exception.MigrationNotFoundByStatus: migration_ref = None if migration_ref: src_host = migration_ref['source_compute'] # Call since this can race with the terminate_instance. # The resize is done but awaiting confirmation/reversion, # so there are two cases: # 1. up-resize: here -instance['vcpus'/'memory_mb'] match # the quota usages accounted for this instance, # so no further quota adjustment is needed # 2. down-resize: here -instance['vcpus'/'memory_mb'] are # shy by delta(old, new) from the quota usages accounted # for this instance, so we must adjust deltas = self._downsize_quota_delta(context, instance) downsize_reservations = self._reserve_quota_delta(context, deltas) self._record_action_start(context, instance, instance_actions.CONFIRM_RESIZE) self.compute_rpcapi.confirm_resize(context, instance, migration_ref, host=src_host, cast=False, reservations=downsize_reservations) @check_instance_state(vm_state=[vm_states.RESIZED])

subject: Fix a race condition in add_tunnel_endpoint()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4df3292e7e5bc59d657727aa3abe1240732ff4b1', 'message': "Fix a race condition in add_tunnel_endpoint()

If there are multiple OVS agents concurrently executing
'tunnel_sync' RPC call a race condition can may occur
leading to insertion of two different TunnelEndpoint
entries having the same 'id' value.

The proposed fix:
  - ensures there is a unique constraint set for 'id' column
  - wraps creation of a new TunnelEndpoint entry into a
    repeatedly executed transactional block (so even if a concurrent
    DB transaction has been flushed or commited earlier than this one
    we can handle an integrity error and try again, in spite of the
    specified transactions isolation level value)

Fixes bug 1167916.

Change-Id: I62dc729d595f090436199d5e1b6b98a884ead7a5
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/da9170a625a0b26a410d87a6b12a0daef641881d', 'message': "Fix a race condition in add_tunnel_endpoint()

If there are multiple OVS agents concurrently executing
'tunnel_sync' RPC call a race condition can occur
leading to insertion of two different TunnelEndpoint
entries having the same 'id' value.

Unfortunately, we can not rely on:
  - @lockutils.synchronized(), because a Quantum installation can use
    more than one API node
  - with_lockmode('update'), because it works differently in PostgreSQL
    comparing to MySQL and doesn't guarantee that no new rows have been
    added to the table since the select query was issued. Please take a
    look at http://www.postgresql.org/files/developer/concurrency.pdf for
    more details.

The proposed fix:
  - ensures there is a unique constraint set for 'id' column
  - wraps creation of a new TunnelEndpoint entry into a
    repeatedly executed transactional block (so even if a concurrent
    DB transaction has been flushed or commited earlier than this one
    we can handle an integrity error and try again, in spite of the
    specified transactions isolation level value)

Fixes bug 1167916.

Change-Id: I62dc729d595f090436199d5e1b6b98a884ead7a5

    more details.

The proposed fix:
  - ensures there is a unique constraint set for 'id' column
  - wraps creation of a new TunnelEndpoint entry into a

Fixes bug 1167916.

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2013-07-30 15:38:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d720942572fc654a0327200852c409ef87bf8979', 'message': "Fix a race condition in add_tunnel_endpoint()

Unfortunately, we can not rely on:

commit_message:
Fix a race condition in add_tunnel_endpoint()

If there are multiple OVS agents concurrently executing
'tunnel_sync' RPC call a race condition can occur
leading to insertion of two different TunnelEndpoint
entries having the same 'id' value.

Unfortunately, we can not rely on:
  - @lockutils.synchronized(), because a Neutron installation can use
    more than one API node
  - with_lockmode('update'), because it works differently in PostgreSQL
    comparing to MySQL and doesn't guarantee that no new rows have been
    added to the table since the select query was issued. Please take a
    look at http://www.postgresql.org/files/developer/concurrency.pdf for
    more details.

The proposed fix:
  - ensures there is a unique constraint set for 'id' column
  - wraps creation of a new TunnelEndpoint entry into a
    repeatedly executed transactional block (so even if a concurrent
    DB transaction has been flushed or commited earlier than this one
    we can handle an integrity error and try again, in spite of the
    specified transactions isolation level value)

Fixes bug 1167916

Change-Id: I62dc729d595f090436199d5e1b6b98a884ead7a5

added_lines: import mock import sqlalchemyfrom quantum.plugins.openvswitch import ovs_models_v2 as ovs_models def test_add_tunnel_endpoint_create_new_endpoint(self): transaction = self.session.begin(subtransactions=True) try: addr = '10.0.0.1' ovs_db_v2.add_tunnel_endpoint(addr) self.assertIsNotNone(self.session.query(ovs_models.TunnelEndpoint). filter_by(ip_address=addr).first()) finally: transaction.rollback() def test_add_tunnel_endpoint_retrieve_an_existing_endpoint(self): transaction = self.session.begin(subtransactions=True) try: addr = '10.0.0.1' self.session.add(ovs_models.TunnelEndpoint(ip_address=addr, id=1)) self.session.flush() tunnel = ovs_db_v2.add_tunnel_endpoint(addr) self.assertEquals(tunnel.id, 1) self.assertEquals(tunnel.ip_address, addr) finally: transaction.rollback() def test_add_tunnel_endpoint_handle_integrity_error(self): with mock.patch.object(sqlalchemy.orm.Session, 'query') as query_mock: error = sqlalchemy.exc.IntegrityError('stub', 'stub', 'stub') query_mock.side_effect = error with testtools.ExpectedException(q_exc.QuantumException): ovs_db_v2.add_tunnel_endpoint('10.0.0.1', 5) self.assertEquals(query_mock.call_count, 5)
